intro: Sida amplifolia, commonly known as broadleaf sida, is an herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida amplifolia is typically found in moist habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks.
